Description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took action against two credit card add-on product vendors, Affinion Group Holdings, Inc., Affinion's affiliated companies, and Intersections Inc. for unfairly charging consumers for credit card add-on benefits they did not receive. Under the proposed consent orders, Affinion would pay approximately $6.8 million in monetary relief for eligible consumers who have not yet received refunds and $1.9 million in civil money penalties, while Intersections would pay approximately $55,000 in monetary relief to eligible consumers who have not yet received refunds and $1.2 million in civil money penalties.
Info Source: http://www.consumerfinance.gov/about-us/newsroom/cfpb-takes-action-against-companies-for-unfair-billing-of-credit-card-add-on-products-and-services/

https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2000-63.txt

Description: The United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and Eagle Global Logistics f/k/a Eagle U.S.A. Info Source: https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/archive/10-01-01.html
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: Fifty-five hospitals in 21 states agreed to pay the United States a total of more than $34 million to settle allegations that they submitted false claims to Medicare for kyphoplasty, a minimally-invasive procedure used to treat certain spinal fractures that often are due to osteoporosis.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/fifty-five-hospitals-pay-us-more-34-million-resolve-false-claims-act-allegations-related
https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L04899#p1_z5_gD_lEA
https://www.tdi.texas.gov/commissioner/disciplinary-orders/documents/20216674.pdf

Description: On August 1, 2016, Palestine Regional Medical Center (PRMC), in Palestine, Texas, entered into a $45,000 settlement agreement with OIG. The settlement agreement resolved allegations that PRMC violated the Emergency Medical Treatment and Labor Act (EMTALA) when it failed to provide stabilizing treatment and an appropriate transfer to a patient who presented to PRMC's emergency department. OIG's investigation revealed that a patient, who had a kidney transplant and was on dialysis, was waiting in the parking lot of a local dialysis center when she experienced significant shortness of breath.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Info Source: https://oig.hhs.gov/fraud/enforcement/cmp/cmp-ae.asp

Description: Affinion agreed to pay $30 million to settle multistate allegations that it misled consumers into signing up and paying for discount clubs and membership.
Info Source: https://www.doj.state.or.us/media-home/news-media-releases/oregon-other-states-reach-30-million-judgment-against-negative-option-marketer/?hilite=%27affinion%27

Description: Affinion Group, Inc. and its subsidiary Trilegiant agreed to pay $8 million to settle allegations they tricked hundreds of thousands of New York consumers into signing up for discount clubs that charged hidden fees.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101110021822/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2010/aug/aug18a_10.html

Description: America Online agreed to pay $3 million to settle multistate litigation concerning complaints that the online service failed to disclose terms and conditions of paid service and made it extremely difficult for consumers to cancel their service.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/brown-resolves-confusing-aol-cancellation-policy

Description: AOL agreed to pay $1.25 million and reform its customer service practices to resolve a case brought by the New York Attorney General.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101113153727/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2005/aug/aug24a_05.html
Attorney General Petro Settles Lawsuit with AOL, US States News, June 8, 2005 (via Nexis).

Description: AOL & Time Warner jointly paid $50 million to settle allegations that they misrepresented advertising revenues and growth, thus artificially inflating the value of their stock when they were a single company. The announcement did not indicate how the cost was to be divided between the companies, so we assume it was split equally between the two.
Info Source: http://www.law.state.ak.us/press/releases/2006/120706-TimeWarner.html

Description: Aviva agreed to pay $4 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: State Announces A Multi-Million Dollar Settlement with Aviva, Targeted News Service, November 21, 2013 (via Nexis).

Secondary Offense: child labor or youth employment violation
Description: Qdoba Restaurant Corporation was cited $409,400 in penalties for more than 1,000 child labor law violations at its 22 corporate-owned locations in Massachusetts.
Info Source: https://www.mass.gov/news/ag-healey-cites-qdoba-restaurant-chain-more-than-400000-penalty-for-child-labor-violations-at
https://web.archive.org/web/20101110015128/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2010/sep/sep21a_10.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101119024158/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2003/oct/oct01a_03.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101113151519/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2005/oct/oct12a_05.html

Company: Vaughan Regional Medical Center et al.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdal/pr/qui-tam-lawsuit-and-federal-investigation-result-145-million-settlement-vaughan

Description: Smart & Final agreed to pay a $437,500 civil penalty and $3.6 million in restitution in settlement of allegations by the Santa Clara, Santa Barbara and Solano District Attorneys and the City Attorney for the City of San Diego that it failed to charge the advertised or posted prices for items at its checkout registers.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2006/prosecutors-settle-scanner-case.aspx
https://www.faa.gov/news/press_releases/news_story.cfm?newsId=19534

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.

Description: American Investors Life Insurance Co., AmerUS Life Insurance Co., and Senior Benefit Services, agreed to pay a total of $1.4 million as part of a settlement of allegations of multiple violations of state insurance regulations by the companies or by insurance producers under inadequate supervision.
Info Source: https://www.cards.commerce.state.mn.us/CARDS/security/search.do?documentId={4EC24FAD-7747-4D00-9DA8-845F6F433A99}

Company: Athene Life Insurance Company of New York
Description: Athene Life Insurance Company of New York entered into a consent order with the Department of Financial Services under which it agreed to pay a fine of $15 million after DFS found that Athene did not provide required information to about 15,000 policyholders, including premium notices, annual reports or cash surrender value notices, and annual privacy notices from 2015 to 2017.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Info Source: https://www.dfs.ny.gov/reports_and_publications/press_releases/pr1806281

Description: Athene Holding Ltd agreed to pay a $45 million penalty to New York State for New York Insurance Law violations related to its subsidiary Athene Annuity & Life Company and its pension risk transfer business.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Info Source: https://www.dfs.ny.gov/press_releases/pr202004132
https://doi.sc.gov/DocumentCenter/View/5951/Liberty-Life-Insurance-Company-

Description: Fine levied for failing to file manual of classifications, manual of rules and rates and any modifications thereof with the OIC before using such rates. RCW 48.19.010
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Info Source: https://fortress.wa.gov/oic/consumertoolkit/search.aspx?searchtype=ord

Description: $10,000 fine levied for failing to keep full and adequate accounts and records, failing to timely respond to inquiries from the Insurance Commissioner, and failing to timely respond to claimants. RCW 48.05.280, WAC 284-30-360(2), WAC 284-30-360(3), WAC 284-30-650
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Info Source: https://fortress.wa.gov/oic/consumertoolkit/search.aspx?searchtype=ord
